indic_aug.basic package¶

class indic_aug.basic.DropoutAugmentor(src_input_path, tgt_input_path, p, augment=True, random_state=1)[source]¶

Bases: indic_aug.globals.Augmentor

Class to augment parallel corpora by dropout (refer: Iyyer et al. [1]).

Constructor method.

Parameters

  • src_input_path (str) – Path to aligned source corpus.

  • tgt_input_path (str) – Path to aligned target corpus, corresponding to the above source corpus.

  • p (float) – Same as for dropout_aug.

  • augment (bool) – Performs augmentation if True, else returns original pair of sentences.

  • random_state (int) – Seed for the random number generator.

class indic_aug.basic.SynonymAugmentor(src_input_path, tgt_input_path, vocab_dir, p, stanza_dir=None, augment=True, random_state=1)[source]¶

Bases: indic_aug.globals.Augmentor

Class to augment parallel corpora by synonym augmentation technique (refer: Wei and Zou [3]).

Constructor method.

Parameters

  • src_input_path (str) – Path to aligned source corpus.

  • tgt_input_path (str) – Path to aligned target corpus, corresponding to the above source corpus.

  • vocab_dir (str) – As described in the docstring for indic_aug.vocab.Vocab.

  • p (float) – Same as for synonym_aug.

  • stanza_dir (str) – Path to directory containing stanza models (the default is ~/stanza_resources on doing a stanza.download).

  • augment (bool) – Performs augmentation if True, else returns original pair of sentences.

  • random_state (int) – Seed for the random number generator.

Performs augmentation on a document by dropout (refer: Iyyer et al. [1]).

Parameters

  • doc (str) – Document to be augmented.

  • p (float) – Probability of a word to be dropped.

  • lang (str) – ISO 639-1 language code of doc.

Augmented document.

indic_aug.basic.noising.count_bigrams(path)[source]¶

Returns the count of all the bigrams that appear in the corpus at path. Corpus at path must be formatted so that each line contains a document, and each document may contain one or more sentences terminated either by the fullstop character (.) or the poorna virama character (।). Each sentence is made of space-separated tokens.

Parameters

path (str) – Path to input corpus.

Returns

Map of bigram (represented as a 2-tuple) to number of occurrences of that bigram.

Return type

dict

indic_aug.basic.noising.count_unigrams(path)[source]¶

Returns the count of all the unigrams that appear in the corpus at path. Corpus at path must be formatted so that each line contains a document, and each document may contain one or more sentences terminated either by the fullstop character (.) or the poorna virama character (।). Each sentence is made of space-separated tokens.

Parameters

path (str) – Path to input corpus.

Returns

Map of unigram to number of occurrences of that unigram.

Return type

dict

indic_aug.basic.noising.find_next_sets(bigram_counts)[source]¶

Returns the next set of first unigrams occurring in bigram_counts.

Defining next set of a word as the set of second unigrams where that word is the first unigram. For example, say we have the bigrams (‘hello’, ‘world’), (‘hello’, ‘alice’) and (‘hello’, ‘bob’), then the next set of ‘hello’ would be {‘world’, ‘alice’, ‘bob’}.

Return value of this function is a dictionary of first unigram to its next set pairs.

Parameters

bigram_counts (dict) – Dictionary of bigram (2-tuple) to bigram count pairs, as returned by count_bigrams.

Returns

Next sets of all first unigrams.

Return type

dict

indic_aug.basic.noising.find_prev_sets(bigram_counts)[source]¶

Returns the prev set of second unigrams occurring in bigram_counts.

Defining prev set of a word as the set of first unigrams where that word is the second unigram. For example, say we have the bigrams (‘red’, ‘flag’), (‘green’, ‘flag’), (‘white’, ‘flag’), then the prev set of ‘flag’ would be {‘red’, ‘green’, ‘flag’}.

Return value of this function is a dictionary of first unigram to its next set pairs.

Parameters

bigram_counts (dict) – Dictionary of bigram (2-tuple) to bigram count pairs, as returned by count_bigrams.

Returns

Next sets of all first unigrams.

Return type

dict

indic_aug.basic.noising.noising_aug(doc, mode, gamma0, unigram_counts, lang, next_sets, prev_sets=None)[source]¶

Performs augmentation on a document by blanking/replacement (refer: Xie et al. [2]).

Supports all the four modes specified in the paper:
  • blank: Replaces token with BLANK_TOKEN with noising probability

    gamma0.

  • replace: Replaces token with another token from the unigram

    distribution with noising probability gamma0.

  • absolute_discount: Replaces token with another token from the

    unigram distribution with absoute discounted probability obtained from gamma0.

  • kneser_ney: Replaces token with another token from its prev set with

    absoute discounted probability obtained from gamma0, analogous to Kneser-Ney smoothing.

Parameters

  • doc (str) – Document to be augmented.

  • mode (str) – One of the modes described above.

  • gamma0 (float) – Noising probability. Values are clipped to range [0, 1].

  • lang (str) – ISO 639-1 language code of doc.

  • next_sets (dict) – Next sets of all tokens in corpus, as returned by find_next_sets.

  • prev_sets (dict) – Prev sets of all tokens in corpus, as returned by find_next_sets, optional. Required if mode is ‘kneser_ney’, else ignored.

Returns

Augmented document.

Return type

str

indic_aug.basic.noising.sample_word(unigram_counts)[source]¶

Samples words from a probability distribution of words.

Parameters

unigram_counts – Map of words (str) to their number of occurrences (int), as returned by count_unigrams.

Type

dict

Returns

Word randomly sampled according to the probability distribution of counts.

Return type

str

indic_aug.basic.synonym module¶

class indic_aug.basic.synonym.SynonymAugmentor(src_input_path, tgt_input_path, vocab_dir, p, stanza_dir=None, augment=True, random_state=1)[source]¶

Bases: indic_aug.globals.Augmentor

Class to augment parallel corpora by synonym augmentation technique (refer: Wei and Zou [3]).

Constructor method.

Parameters

  • src_input_path (str) – Path to aligned source corpus.

  • tgt_input_path (str) – Path to aligned target corpus, corresponding to the above source corpus.

  • vocab_dir (str) – As described in the docstring for indic_aug.vocab.Vocab.

  • p (float) – Same as for synonym_aug.

  • stanza_dir (str) – Path to directory containing stanza models (the default is ~/stanza_resources on doing a stanza.download).

  • augment (bool) – Performs augmentation if True, else returns original pair of sentences.

  • random_state (int) – Seed for the random number generator.

indic_aug.basic.synonym.convert_pos(stanza_pos, to)[source]¶

Converts Universal Dependencies parts of speech to WordNet/IndoWordNet parts of speech.

Parameters

  • stanza_pos (str) – POS defined by Universal Dependencies.

  • to (str) – POS to convert to, can be ‘wn’ for WordNet and ‘iwn’ for IndoWordNet.

Returns

POS in WordNet/IndoWordNet format.

Return type

str if to is ‘wn’, pyiwn.iwn.PosTag if to is ‘iwn’

indic_aug.basic.synonym.find_synonyms(word, pipeline, net)[source]¶

Returns a list of synonyms of word.

Parameters

  • word (str) – Word whose synonym is required.

  • pipeline (stanza.Pipeline) – stanza.Pipeline corresponding to language of word.

  • net (nltk.corpus.reader.wordnet.WordNetCorpusReader for English and pyiwn.iwn.IndoWordNet for Indian languages.) – Thesaurus (word net) to use. Use nltk.corpus.wordnet for English and pyiwn.iwn.IndoWordNet() for Indian languages.

Returns

List of synonyms for word.

Return type

list

indic_aug.basic.synonym.synonym_aug(doc, pipeline, net, vocab, p)[source]¶

Performs augmentation on a document by replacing with synonyms (refer: Wei and Zou [3]).

Parameters

  • doc (str) – Document to be augmented.

  • pipeline (stanza.Pipeline) – Same as for find_synonyms.

  • net (nltk.corpus.reader.wordnet.WordNetCorpusReader for English and pyiwn.iwn.IndoWordNet for Indian languages.) – Same as for find_synonyms.

  • vocab (list(str)) – List of words in vocabulary.

  • p (float) – Probability of a word to be replaced by one of its synonyms.

Returns

Augmented document.

Return type

str
